project.teaser: The EU Biodiversity Strategy (BDS) requires expanding the spatial coverage of marine protected areas to 30%, with 10% strict protection. Achieving the current 14-17% coverage has taken the Baltic Sea region 30 years, and strict protection remains almost non-existent. To meet...
project.title: Enabling comprehensive effective and efficient protection and restoration measures for a resilient Baltic Sea ecosystem
project.keywords: MPA, restoration, governance, management, designation, protection framework

article.title: A new approach to safeguard Baltic Sea biodiversity

result.title: Project website
result.description: The project website contains all relevant information about the project including news and serves as a one-stop platform for all project partners where all work-related resources can be accessed. In English. Related to task 9.3 Project website.

result.title: Draft blueprint for process for idenfitying a list of protection targets for species and habitats
result.description: Determining protection targets and indicators (HELCOM, SwAM, SLU, BfN, SYKE, VSTT, MoE, AAU): will determine ecologically relevant SMART protection targets for spatial protection, using a semi-quantified matrix. T6.3 will also identify protection indicators, to assess effectiveness and progress towards targets.

result.title: Project video
result.description: The project video provides insights into the project, its structure, partners, objectives and intended outcomes. In English. Related to task T.9.11 Project video.

result.title: Social media
result.description: Based on the communication strategy (D9.1), the social media strategy guides the use of the social media accounts that will be opened under the project. In English, PDF publication, social media channels. Related to task 9.4 Social media.

result.title: Visual identity and communication toolkit
result.description: The visual identity comprises logo, colour scheme, fonts and other graphical elements. The communication toolkit contains templates for all sorts of print and digital communication products. In English, PDF publication, various templates (InDesign, Illustrator, Premiere). Related to task 9.2 Visual identity and communication toolkit.

result.title: Communication strategy
result.description: A roadmap for all communication actions, including a plan for communication and dissemination, along the duration of the project, the communication strategy and plan will address both internal and external communication components. In English, PDF publication. Related to task 9.1 Communication

result.title: MPA Portal user interface
result.description: Based on the visual identity developed (D9.2), the interface of the MPA Portal will be developed in collaboration with the work package in charge of developing the MPA Portal (WP8). In English, Photoshop and Illustrator formats. Related to task 9.5 MPA portal user interface.

result.title: Exploitation strategy
result.description: Developing a long-term sustainability strategy, ensuring continued delivery of results after the project and securing uptake of project outputs. The Sustainability strategy will be based on the original exploitation strategy developed at the beginning of the project as well as the interim analysis of exploitation impact.

result.title: Report on what data has been collated and uploaded to the various database
result.description: Report describing which data has been collated and uploaded to the various database/portal to illustrate how various portals/databases have been enriched.

result.title: Requirement specification of the HELCOM MPA portal
result.description: Defining requirement specification for HELCOM MPA portal (HELCOM): T8.1 will establish the requirement specification of the HELCOM MPA portal and define the data model for the HELCOM MPA database; the MPA portal user interface; the users and roles of MPA portal (public vs. editor); and the required integration with other tools and databases. The requirement specifications will be carried out as in textual description (documentation) including wire frame of the MPA portal UI. Requirement specifications will guidance tasks 8.2 and 8.3 on developing the MPA database and portal. The requirement specifications will be gathered by project staff by having planning sessions with key stakeholders identified (MPA managers, portal users).

result.title: Project opening conference
result.description: Opening and closing events. In addition, smaller online conferences and round tables on specific topics will be held during key dates of the project. Related to task 9.10 project conferences.

result.title: Overview of MPA managers needs with regards to the MPA Management Guideline
result.description: Updating Guidelines for MPA management (MHPWF, BfN, HELCOM, SLU, SYKE, UTARTU; VSTT): update the guidelines for MPA management. A review of the content of the current guidelines will be conducted, a literature review will be conducted on relevant national guidelines, publications and experiences in the Baltic (e.g. the Swedish framework of MPAs), as well as from other parts of the world (e.g. The MPA Guide, IUCN guidance etc.). Based on the identified update needs workshops on specific topics will be arranged within HELCOM.

result.title: Updated Map and data service for the Baltic Sea region
result.description: The data collated on the environmental conditions and in the Baltic Sea will be made available in English in the HELCOM Map and Data Services.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - PROTECT BALTIC (Enabling comprehensive effective and efficient protection and restoration measures for a resilient Baltic Sea ecosystem)
result.teaser: PROTECT BALTIC - an ambitious approach for implementing ecologically coherent and effectively managed MPAs in the Baltic Sea PROTECT BALTIC supports the biodiversity goals of the Baltic Sea Action Plan, EU Biodiversity Strategy, and CBD Global Biodiversity Targets for the...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Updated gap analysis of data in order to get a clear overview of further data needs and infrastructure development
result.description: Updated gap analysis of data to get a clear overview of further data needs and infrastructure development. Related to task 2.6 Gap analysis of further data needs.

result.title: Overview of environment predictor factors to be included in the models
result.description: A report on what environmental predictor factors have been identified as necessary for inclusion in the modelling effort in order to ensure ecological relevance of the subsequent species and habitat models.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
